greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Fully multiplicative with a(prime(i)) = 2^i; If n = product_{k >= 1} (p_k)^(c_k) where p_k is k-th prime A000040(k) and c_k >= 0 then a(n) = product_{k >= 1} 2^(k*c_k).
comment: Equally, if n = p_i * p_j * ... * p_k, where p_i, p_j, ..., p_k are the primes A000040(i), A000040(j), ..., A000040(k) in the prime factorization of n (indices i, j, ..., k not necessarily distinct), then a(n) = 2^i * 2^j * 2^k.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2048
program: (MIT/GNU Scheme, with Aubrey Jaffer's SLIB Scheme library)
(PARI) A248692(n) = if(1==n,n,my(f=factor(n)); for(i=1,#f~,f[i,1] = 2^primepi(f[i,1])); factorback(f)); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 01 2021
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 11 2014
